THE ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING STATIONS
(and a special request mailing list)
Ten days ago we released a bulletin from this office dealing with the pro¬
position of a statement to be made up by the various member stations and
submitted to the Federal Radio Commission as well as the senators and con¬
gressmen of the state in which the university or college station is located.
You will recall that this suggestion was made by Professor J. C. Jensen, Di¬
rector of Radio Station WCAJ, Nebraska Wesleyan University, Lincoln, Nebraska,
Mr. Jensen has recently received a letter from Mr. Armstrong Perry stating in
essence that this would be a very valuable piece of work for the Association
to place before the Federal Radio Commission and others named.
It is quite necessary if statements of this type are attempted that we have
at least a majority of the member stations of the Association agreed upon
sending these to the parties named. Your officers personally feel that this
matter should be attended to immediately upon receipt of this bulletin (in
case your station has not already submitted the statement). You recall that
seven main points were emphasized in the bulletin asking that the stations give
the Commission and others information dealing with this particular point. In
order that you may have these points before you again and to help you in as¬
sembling information for the statement we are again listing them as follows*
1. Power, time and frequency used by your station April 1, 1927.
2. Power, time and frequency first assigned by the Commission in June, 1927.
3. Details regarding each change in power, time and frequency required since
June, 1927, with dates.
4. Limitation to daylight time, giving dates and details of order and effect
upon broadcast program.
5. Request by the station for improvements in time, power and frequency, and
a statement of the Commissions action.
6. Details regarding any applications now pending.
7. A summary of hearings held before the Commission together with costs to
the university and outcome of the same.
